title: Make Apple Clang a separate compiler from LLVM Clang
body:
As a user I want Apple Clang to be a separate compiler from LLVM Clang so that they are distinguished more clearly.

### Rationale

Despite the name of Apple's compiler is just `clang` the version numbers differ from vanilla LLVM and have to be distinguished by a `-apple` suffix. This is causing a complexity increase in e.g. the code that injects microarchitecture specific flags and is inconsistent with the treatment of other LLVM based compilers like `armclang`.

### Description

The proposed solution is to turn Apple Clang into a separate compiler named `appleclang` and reserve `clang` for vanilla LLVM.


### Additional information

Once implemented this modification will change the hashes of every spec built with Apple Clang. This likely means the modification should go into the next minor release after the merge, not the next patch release.

### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
